page.title: 22Changing Times in Kimpton
page.content:
Since 1986 the following changes have happened:

Probyn House is due to close to be replaced by houses suitable for the elderly.

There is only one shop which includes a Post Office. The garage has been replaced by Wheelrights, a row of terraced houses in keeping with the Victorian terrace opposite.

An additional sports area for cricket, tennis and netball has been developed behind parkfield Crescent.

In 2001 the flooding problem became a reality when springs near Luton Airport sent water down the valley into the village via Claggy Road into the High Street. Houses were flooded for months.
S.L.Ryder
